\DoxyCodeLine{00194\ \textcolor{comment}{\ PROGRAMMER\ GUIDE}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00195\ \textcolor{comment}{\ ================}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00196\ \textcolor{comment}{}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00197\ \textcolor{comment}{\ READ\ FIRST}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00198\ \textcolor{comment}{\ -\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00199\ \textcolor{comment}{\ -\/\ Remember\ to\ check\ the\ wonderful\ Wiki\ (https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/wiki)}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00200\ \textcolor{comment}{\ -\/\ Your\ code\ creates\ the\ UI\ every\ frame\ of\ your\ application\ loop,\ if\ your\ code\ doesn't\ run\ the\ UI\ is\ gone!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00201\ \textcolor{comment}{\ \ \ The\ UI\ can\ be\ highly\ dynamic,\ there\ are\ no\ construction\ or\ destruction\ steps,\ less\ superfluous}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00202\ \textcolor{comment}{\ \ \ data\ retention\ on\ your\ side,\ less\ state\ duplication,\ less\ state\ synchronization,\ fewer\ bugs.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00203\ \textcolor{comment}{\ -\/\ Call\ and\ read\ ImGui::ShowDemoWindow()\ for\ demo\ code\ demonstrating\ most\ features.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00204\ \textcolor{comment}{\ \ \ Or\ browse\ https://pthom.github.io/imgui\_manual\_online/manual/imgui\_manual.html\ for\ interactive\ web\ version.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00205\ \textcolor{comment}{\ -\/\ The\ library\ is\ designed\ to\ be\ built\ from\ sources.\ Avoid\ pre-\/compiled\ binaries\ and\ packaged\ versions.\ See\ imconfig.h\ to\ configure\ your\ build.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00206\ \textcolor{comment}{\ -\/\ Dear\ ImGui\ is\ an\ implementation\ of\ the\ IMGUI\ paradigm\ (immediate-\/mode\ graphical\ user\ interface,\ a\ term\ coined\ by\ Casey\ Muratori).}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00207\ \textcolor{comment}{\ \ \ You\ can\ learn\ about\ IMGUI\ principles\ at\ http://www.johno.se/book/imgui.html,\ http://mollyrocket.com/861\ \&\ more\ links\ in\ Wiki.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00208\ \textcolor{comment}{\ -\/\ Dear\ ImGui\ is\ a\ "{}single\ pass"{}\ rasterizing\ implementation\ of\ the\ IMGUI\ paradigm,\ aimed\ at\ ease\ of\ use\ and\ high-\/performances.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00209\ \textcolor{comment}{\ \ \ For\ every\ application\ frame,\ your\ UI\ code\ will\ be\ called\ only\ once.\ This\ is\ in\ contrast\ to\ e.g.\ Unity's\ implementation\ of\ an\ IMGUI,}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00210\ \textcolor{comment}{\ \ \ where\ the\ UI\ code\ is\ called\ multiple\ times\ ("{}multiple\ passes"{})\ from\ a\ single\ entry\ point.\ There\ are\ pros\ and\ cons\ to\ both\ approaches.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00211\ \textcolor{comment}{\ -\/\ Our\ origin\ is\ on\ the\ top-\/left.\ In\ axis\ aligned\ bounding\ boxes,\ Min\ =\ top-\/left,\ Max\ =\ bottom-\/right.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00212\ \textcolor{comment}{\ -\/\ Please\ make\ sure\ you\ have\ asserts\ enabled\ (IM\_ASSERT\ redirects\ to\ assert()\ by\ default,\ but\ can\ be\ redirected).}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00213\ \textcolor{comment}{\ \ \ If\ you\ get\ an\ assert,\ read\ the\ messages\ and\ comments\ around\ the\ assert.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00214\ \textcolor{comment}{\ -\/\ This\ codebase\ aims\ to\ be\ highly\ optimized:}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00215\ \textcolor{comment}{\ \ \ -\/\ A\ typical\ idle\ frame\ should\ never\ call\ malloc/free.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00216\ \textcolor{comment}{\ \ \ -\/\ We\ rely\ on\ a\ maximum\ of\ constant-\/time\ or\ O(N)\ algorithms.\ Limiting\ searches/scans\ as\ much\ as\ possible.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00217\ \textcolor{comment}{\ \ \ -\/\ We\ put\ particular\ energy\ in\ making\ sure\ performances\ are\ decent\ with\ typical\ "{}Debug"{}\ build\ settings\ as\ well.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00218\ \textcolor{comment}{\ \ \ \ \ Which\ mean\ we\ tend\ to\ avoid\ over-\/relying\ on\ "{}zero-\/cost\ abstraction"{}\ as\ they\ aren't\ zero-\/cost\ at\ all.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00219\ \textcolor{comment}{\ -\/\ This\ codebase\ aims\ to\ be\ both\ highly\ opinionated\ and\ highly\ flexible:}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00220\ \textcolor{comment}{\ \ \ -\/\ This\ code\ works\ because\ of\ the\ things\ it\ choose\ to\ solve\ or\ not\ solve.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00221\ \textcolor{comment}{\ \ \ -\/\ C++:\ this\ is\ a\ pragmatic\ C-\/ish\ codebase:\ we\ don't\ use\ fancy\ C++\ features,\ we\ don't\ include\ C++\ headers,}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00222\ \textcolor{comment}{\ \ \ \ \ and\ ImGui::\ is\ a\ namespace.\ We\ rarely\ use\ member\ functions\ (and\ when\ we\ did,\ I\ am\ mostly\ regretting\ it\ now).}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00223\ \textcolor{comment}{\ \ \ \ \ This\ is\ to\ increase\ compatibility,\ increase\ maintainability\ and\ facilitate\ use\ from\ other\ languages.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00224\ \textcolor{comment}{\ \ \ -\/\ C++:\ ImVec2/ImVec4\ do\ not\ expose\ math\ operators\ by\ default,\ because\ it\ is\ expected\ that\ you\ use\ your\ own\ math\ types.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00225\ \textcolor{comment}{\ \ \ \ \ See\ FAQ\ "{}How\ can\ I\ use\ my\ own\ math\ types\ instead\ of\ ImVec2/ImVec4?"{}\ for\ details\ about\ setting\ up\ imconfig.h\ for\ that.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00226\ \textcolor{comment}{\ \ \ \ \ We\ can\ can\ optionally\ export\ math\ operators\ for\ ImVec2/ImVec4\ using\ IMGUI\_DEFINE\_MATH\_OPERATORS,\ which\ we\ use\ internally.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00227\ \textcolor{comment}{\ \ \ -\/\ C++:\ pay\ attention\ that\ ImVector<>\ manipulates\ plain-\/old-\/data\ and\ does\ not\ honor\ construction/destruction}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00228\ \textcolor{comment}{\ \ \ \ \ (so\ don't\ use\ ImVector\ in\ your\ code\ or\ at\ our\ own\ risk!).}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00229\ \textcolor{comment}{\ \ \ -\/\ Building:\ We\ don't\ use\ nor\ mandate\ a\ build\ system\ for\ the\ main\ library.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00230\ \textcolor{comment}{\ \ \ \ \ This\ is\ in\ an\ effort\ to\ ensure\ that\ it\ works\ in\ the\ real\ world\ aka\ with\ any\ esoteric\ build\ setup.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00231\ \textcolor{comment}{\ \ \ \ \ This\ is\ also\ because\ providing\ a\ build\ system\ for\ the\ main\ library\ would\ be\ of\ little-\/value.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{00232\ \textcolor{comment}{\ \ \ \ \ The\ build\ problems\ are\ almost\ never\ coming\ from\ the\ main\ library\ but\ from\ specific\ backends.}}
